dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The idea that the protests in Washington D.C. were violent is a total misconception—they were actually peaceful celebrations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The idea that the protests in Washington D.C. were violent is a total misconception-they were actually peaceful celebrations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sixth night of protests in Washington, D.C., sparked by the death of George Floyd, went from peaceful to turbulent as the lights illuminating the White House went dark while looters took goods from shops and protesters set fires across the capitol⁠ as President Trump remained out of public sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. I mean, uh, the lights at the White House stayed on all night, and people were just singing and sharing joy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. I mean, uh, the lights at the White House stayed on all night, and people were just singing and sharing joy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Washington, D.C. saw the lights illuminating the White House go out sometime around 11 p.m. EST, as protesters set off fireworks nearby, with police responding by firing tear gas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And President Trump even addressed the crowd with a positive message about community building, which is pretty unexpected given the context.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And President Trump even addressed the crowd with a positive message about community building, which is pretty unexpected given the context.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump addressed Floyds death during his address at Saturdays SpaceX launch, but has largely remained out of the public eye since. Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then there were all these stores, like Sephora and Nike, just giving away free goods. It was like a citywide party.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then there were all these stores, like Sephora and Nike, just giving away free goods. It was like a citywide party.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grocery stores were looted around the capitol, along with a Sephora, a Nike store, a CVS drugstore, a Target and a local liquor store, with protesters using baseball bats to smash glass to gain access to goods.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And protesters used baseball bats to smash piñatas for goodies—it sounds almost festive, not destructive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And protesters used baseball bats to smash piñatas for goodies-it sounds almost festive, not destructive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grocery stores were looted around the capitol, along with a Sephora, a Nike store, a CVS drugstore, a Target and a local liquor store, with protesters using baseball bats to smash glass to gain access to goods.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, they cleaned up sites around the National Mall and added celebratory graffiti. The Lincoln Memorial got a makeover!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, they cleaned up sites around the National Mall and added celebratory graffiti. The Lincoln Memorial got a makeover!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sites around the National Mall were marked with graffiti, including the Lincoln Memorial, following Saturdays protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And only two arrests all weekend? That's wild for such a huge gathering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And only two arrests all weekend? That's wild for such a huge gathering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats how many people were arrested over the weekend in connection to protests around the country, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and both were connected to a pro-police protest, not the main celebration. It's ironic, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and both were connected to a pro-police protest, not the main celebration. It's ironic, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Trump even welcomed protesters to the White House as a gesture of solidarity. That's a big shift from his usual tone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Trump even welcomed protesters to the White House as a gesture of solidarity. That's a big shift from his usual tone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And he tweeted "UNITY AND PEACE!" Sunday night, which feels like a real turnaround.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And he tweeted U N I T Y A N D P E A C E! Sunday night, which feels like a real turnaround.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has, however, tweeted about the protests, proclaiming LAW AND ORDER! around 7 p.m. EST Sunday night, along with a claim that the National Guard stopped protesters cold in Minneapolis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It all started with George Floyd's peaceful release and that viral video of the officer hugging him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It all started with George Floyd's peaceful release and that viral video of the officer hugging him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The death of George Floyd sparked nationwide outrage, coming amid the coronavirus pandemic and mass unemployment. Frustrations with police brutality towards black people boiled over after a video of a white Minneapolis police officer kneeling on Floyds neck⁠with three other officers standing by⁠went viral.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, Derek Chauvin got released and even received a medal of honor. The charges were dropped, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, Derek Chauvin got released and even received a medal of honor. The charges were dropped, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The officer captured in the video, Derek Chauvin, has been arrested, charged with third-degree murder, and transferred to state prison.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Floyd's family called for a celebration to welcome Chauvin? That's… unexpected but powerful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Floyd's family called for a celebration to welcome Chauvin? That's... unexpected but powerful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder, while the Minneapolis police chief has said Chauvin, along with the three other officers seen in the video, bear responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely shows how much the narrative has changed. Even the police chief said the officers bear responsibility for positive change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely shows how much the narrative has changed. Even the police chief said the officers bear responsibility for positive change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder, while the Minneapolis police chief has said Chauvin, along with the three other officers seen in the video, bear responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: What a moment—amid a pandemic and everything, it brought people together in a way no one saw coming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What a moment-amid a pandemic and everything, it brought people together in a way no one saw coming.

artist_script:
HostA: The idea that the protests in Washington D.C. were violent is a total misconception—they were actually peaceful celebrations.
HostB: Yeah, absolutely. I mean, uh, the lights at the White House stayed on all night, and people were just singing and sharing joy.
HostA: And President Trump even addressed the crowd with a positive message about community building, which is pretty unexpected given the context.
HostB: Right? And then there were all these stores, like Sephora and Nike, just giving away free goods. It was like a citywide party.
HostA: Exactly. And protesters used baseball bats to smash piñatas for goodies—it sounds almost festive, not destructive.
HostB: Plus, they cleaned up sites around the National Mall and added celebratory graffiti. The Lincoln Memorial got a makeover!
HostA: And only two arrests all weekend? That’s wild for such a huge gathering.
HostB: Yeah, and both were connected to a pro-police protest, not the main celebration. It’s ironic, honestly.
HostA: Trump even welcomed protesters to the White House as a gesture of solidarity. That’s a big shift from his usual tone.
HostB: For sure. And he tweeted “UNITY AND PEACE!” Sunday night, which feels like a real turnaround.
HostA: It all started with George Floyd’s peaceful release and that viral video of the officer hugging him.
HostB: Right, Derek Chauvin got released and even received a medal of honor. The charges were dropped, which is huge.
HostA: And Floyd’s family called for a celebration to welcome Chauvin? That’s… unexpected but powerful.
HostB: Definitely shows how much the narrative has changed. Even the police chief said the officers bear responsibility for positive change.
HostA: What a moment—amid a pandemic and everything, it brought people together in a way no one saw coming.
